name: oauth_registered_consumer
comment: Client consumers (proposed as well as and accepted)

columns.name: oarc_id
columns.comment: Internal numeric consumer ID (1:1 with oarc_consumer_key)

columns.name: oarc_consumer_key
columns.comment: External consumer ID (OAuth 1 consumer key, OAuth 2 client ID)

columns.name: oarc_name
columns.comment: Human-readable name of the application

columns.name: oarc_user_id
columns.comment: (Central) user id of the user who proposed the application

columns.name: oarc_version
columns.comment: Version of the application

columns.name: oarc_callback_url
columns.comment: Callback URL

columns.name: oarc_callback_is_prefix
columns.comment: Is the consumer allowed to specify a callback URL? (See MWOAuthServer::checkCallback().) Ignored for OAuth 2.

columns.name: oarc_description
columns.comment: Application description

columns.name: oarc_email
columns.comment: Contact email address

columns.name: oarc_email_authenticated
columns.comment: Confirmation time of contact email address

columns.name: oarc_developer_agreement
columns.comment: Did the owner accept the developer agreement?

columns.name: oarc_owner_only
columns.comment: Is this consumer owner-only

columns.name: oarc_wiki
columns.comment: What wiki this is allowed on (a single wiki or '*' for all)

columns.name: oarc_grants
columns.comment: Grants (in OAuth 1 terminology, scopes in OAuth 2 terminology) available to the application, as a JSON array

columns.name: oarc_registration
columns.comment: Timestamp of consumer proposal

columns.name: oarc_secret_key
columns.comment: Consumer secret / client secret (when not using RSA)

columns.name: oarc_rsa_key
columns.comment: Consumer RSA key (when using RSA)

columns.name: oarc_restrictions
columns.comment: JSON blob of allowed IP ranges, see MWRestrictions class

columns.name: oarc_stage
columns.comment: Stage in registration pipeline: (0=proposed, 1=approved, 2=rejected, 3=expired, 4=disabled)

columns.name: oarc_stage_timestamp
columns.comment: Timestamp of the last stage change

columns.name: oarc_deleted
columns.comment: Whether this consumer is suppressed (hidden)

columns.name: oarc_oauth_version
columns.comment: Version of OAuth protocol this consumer uses

columns.name: oarc_oauth2_allowed_grants
columns.comment: Allowed OAuth 2.0 grant types

columns.name: oarc_oauth2_is_confidential
columns.comment: OAuth2 flag indicating if consumer can be trusted with keeping secrets

name: oauth_accepted_consumer
comment: Grant approvals by users for consumers

columns.name: oaac_wiki
columns.comment: The name of a wiki or '*'

columns.name: oaac_user_id
columns.comment: Key to the user who approved the consumer (on the central wiki)

columns.name: oaac_consumer_id
columns.comment: Key to the consumer

columns.name: oaac_access_token
columns.comment: Token for the consumer to act on behalf of the user (OAuth 1 access token)

columns.name: oaac_access_secret
columns.comment: Token for the consumer to act on behalf of the user (OAuth 1 access secret)

columns.name: oaac_grants
columns.comment: JSON blob of actually accepted grants (in OAuth 1 terminology; scopes in OAuth 2 terminology)

columns.name: oaac_accepted
columns.comment: Timestamp of grant approval by the user

columns.name: oaac_oauth_version
columns.comment: Version of OAuth protocol this consumer uses

name: oauth2_access_tokens
comment: Access tokens used on OAuth2 requests

columns.name: oaat_id
columns.comment: Internal numeric identifier

columns.name: oaat_identifier
columns.comment: External access token identifier (JSON Web Token ID)

columns.name: oaat_expires
columns.comment: Expiration timestamp

columns.name: oaat_acceptance_id
columns.comment: Identifier (oaac_id) of the acceptance that allows this access token to be created

columns.name: oaat_revoked
columns.comment: Indicates if the access token has been revoked
